definition: to be fond of/to have a tendency to/to be prone to
good/well/proper/good to/easy to/very/so/(suffix indicating completion or readiness)/(of two people) close/on intimate terms/(after a personal pronoun) hello

sentences.english: She is a Chaplin nut ：She's seen all his films.
sentences.chinese: 她是卓别林的癖好者，凡他演的电影都看过。

sentences.english: Sometimes I think these are people who were just born with those inclinations.
sentences.chinese: 有时我觉得这些人生来就有那些癖好。

sentences.english: I wonder how Mr. Teachout might square such idiosyncrasies with his "art forms as technologies."
sentences.chinese: “艺术形式即技术”的观点来解释这样的个人癖好。

sentences.english: What started out as a hobby soon became a passion.
sentences.chinese: 一种癖好不久便转化成了持久的热情。

sentences.english: I’ve found two ways to try to deal with this tendency.
sentences.chinese: 我有两种策略来处理这种癖好。

sentences.english: She has a mania for driving fast.
Colonel Gaddafi is a man of eccentricities.
sentences.chinese: 卡扎菲上校是个集万千古怪癖好于一身的男人。

sentences.english: He takes special liking to [for] painting and calligraphy.
sentences.chinese: 他对于书画有很深的癖好。

definition: to like/to take pleasure in/keen on/fond of/interest/hobby/appetite for/CL:個|个[ge4]
